attributes.action: pro-actively and fully implement the Equal Pay Act on 1970, and any later amendments, including giving the Equal Opportunities Commission far greater powers to take and implement action; immediately on taking office
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: How is it that, 37 YEARS since the original Equal Pay Act, we STILL see regular reports of gender pay gaps? (always, of course, to women's disadvantage).  Radio Times informs us, as background to a play broadcast on 17th June, that "on average men in the City earn 48%(!) more than women for doing the same job; in the country as a whole that differential is 22%" but there shouldn't be ANY DIFFERENTIAL AT ALL for men and women doing the same job; this was outlawed in 1970.  This massive injustice - one of the worst manifestations of gender inequality there is - must be ended now!
